title: Buy PG Electroplast; target of Rs 623: Geojit Financial Services
content: Geojit Financial Services research report on PG Electroplast PG Electroplast Ltd (PGEL), the flagship entity of PG Group is a leading electronic manufacturing service provider in India, having a diverse portfolio and panIndia presence. In Q1FY26, PGEL reported a revenue growth of ~14% YoY, which is in line with our estimates. However, air conditioner sales faced significant headwinds due to the early onset of the monsoon, which disrupted the seasonal volumes. EBITDA margin declined by 183bps YoY to 8.1% due to negative operating leverage and input cost pressure. The company expects FY26 margin to decline by 1.25-1.5% YoY due to pricing pressure and higher channel inventory. PGEL expects inventory to be cleared in H2FY26 as the seasonal demand picks up. Washing machine sales were robust during the quarter, reported a growth of 36% YoY. PGEL expects the segment to grow 40-45% YoY in FY26. We expect the management’s focus to diversify to other business verticals like refrigerator, EV and compressor manufacturing to keep the longterm story intact. Outlook The stock is currently trading at its 3-year average 1-year forward P/E of 42x, and we expect most of the negatives are factored into the price. We therefore revise our rating to BUY with a downwardly revised TP of Rs 623, based on a P/E of 40x on FY27E EPS. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. PG Electroplast - 18082025 - geo

summary_luhn: In Q1FY26, PGEL reported a revenue growth of ~14% YoY, which is in line with our estimates.

title: Aditya Birla Fashion shares surge 3.8% amid high volume; stock among top midcap gainers today
content: Shares of Aditya Birla Fashion gained 3.80% to trade at Rs 77.85 in Monday's session, witnessing high volume and a jump in trading activity. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Aditya Birla Fashion has demonstrated the following performance. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,831.46 Crore, while the net profit was Rs -227.98 Crore, and the EPS was Rs -1.74. In comparison, the revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 3,427.82 Crore, with a net profit of Rs -214.92 Crore and an EPS of Rs -1.60. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 7,354.73 Crore, with a net profit of Rs -437.94 Crore and an EPS of Rs -3.53. This compares to a revenue of Rs 13,995.86 Crore, a net profit of Rs -748.66 Crore, and an EPS of Rs -6.52 for the year-ending March 2024. title: Glenmark shares fall 3.6%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Glenmark experienced a decline of 3.6%, trading at Rs 1,971.00 in Monday's session. The stock is identified among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index as of 11:30 am. Suzlon Energy fell 2.41% to Rs 58.61, while Deepak Nitrite declined 2.11% to Rs 1,817.40. Reval Reserve]/Share (Rs.)313.60278.09348.70334.48250.36Dividend/Share (Rs.)2.502.502.502.502.50Face Value11111Corporate ActionsGlenmark will hold an earnings call on Monday, August 18, 2025, from 8:30 a.m. to 9:30 a.m. (IST). The trading window was closed from June 30, 2025, to August 16, 2025, for the approval of Unaudited Financial Results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025. Glenmark has consistently distributed a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share over the past several years. Glenmark announced a bonus issue on January 6, 2005, with a bonus ratio of 1:1 and an ex-bonus date of March 4, 2005. Glenmark split its shares on two occasions, once on September 10, 2007, from a face value of Rs 2 to Rs 1, and another on October 23, 2003, from Rs 10 to Rs 2. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,971.00, Glenmark has been identified among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Nifty top gainers: Maruti Suzuki, Nestle,  among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Leading the charge on the Nifty 50 index, Maruti Suzuki's stock soared, marking an impressive 8.19% gain to reach Rs 13,995.00. Nestle followed suit with a substantial 6.77% increase to Rs 1,163.10. Hero Motocorp also demonstrated a strong performance, climbing 6.5% to Rs 5,014.00. Bajaj Finance and M&M rounded out the top gainers, rising by 6.16% to Rs 914.50 and 4.54% to Rs 3,413.80, respectively. The trading session at 11:30 am saw these stocks leading the gains. Financial Snapshot of Maruti Suzuki Maruti Suzuki's financial performance demonstrates consistent growth over the past few years. Here’s an overview:YearRevenueNet ProfitEPSBVPSROEDebt to Equity2021Rs 70,372.00 CroreRs 4,220.10 Crore145.301,738.438.360.012022Rs 88,329.80 CroreRs 3,717.60 Crore128.431,832.247.010.012023Rs 117,571.30 CroreRs 8,033.60 Crore271.822,046.0713.280.022024Rs 141,858.20 CroreRs 13,234.10 Crore429.012,723.7915.750.002025Rs 152,913.00 CroreRs 14,256.30 Crore461.203,061.0715.060.00The company’s revenue has steadily increased, with a notable rise from Rs 70,372.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 152,913.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also seen substantial growth, climbing from Rs 4,220.10 Crore in 2021 to Rs 14,256.30 Crore in 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) have risen from Rs 145.30 in 2021 to Rs 461.20 in 2025. title: Top midcap gainers: Endurance Technologies, Blue Star, Ashok Leyland stocks lead Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: In Monday's session, several stocks recorded significant gains in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Endurance Technologies shares led the pack with a 10.31% increase, reaching Rs 2,870.40. Blue Star followed, rising 7.76% to Rs 1,923.80. Ashok Leyland also showed strong performance, gaining 7.41% to reach Rs 131.00. Vodafone Idea increased by 7.32% to Rs 6.60, while Voltas saw a 7.1% rise, trading at Rs 1,365.30 at 11:30 am. Endurance Technologies's financial performance shows consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 11,560.81 Crore, up from Rs 10,240.87 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also increased to Rs 836.35 Crore from Rs 680.49 Crore in the same period. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 59.46 for the year-ending March 2025. title: Bharti Airtel shares gain 1.46% in today's session; over 28.7 lakh shares traded
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading higher in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,901.10 on the NSE. The stock has seen a gain of 1.46% from its previous close, with over 28.7 lakh shares traded. In terms of quarterly financials, Bharti Airtel has demonstrated substantial revenue and net profit growth. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, compared to Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS also improved from Rs 7.21 to Rs 10.26. The consolidated yearly financials show even more significant growth. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a substantial rise from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The net profit soared to Rs 33,778.30 Crore, compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also saw a sharp increase, jumping from Rs 13.09 to Rs 58.00. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 216.40 to Rs 226.16, and the return on equity (ROE) rose from 7.39% to 25.58%. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased from 1.50 to 1.13. title: Five-Star Business Finance Announces ₹2/Share Dividend for FY25
content: Five-Star Business Finance Limited has announced a final dividend of ₹2 per equity share (200% of face value) for the financial year ended March 31, 2025. This dividend is subject to the approval of the shareholders at the 41st Annual General Meeting (AGM) scheduled for September 9, 2025. The dividend, if declared, will be paid to members whose names appear in the Register of Members of the Company as of Thursday, August 14, 2025, the record date fixed for this purpose.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsFinal Dividend per share₹2.00Record DateAugust 14, 2025The announcement was made on August 18, 2025, following the Board of Directors meeting on April 29, 2025, where the dividend recommendation was approved. In addition to the dividend announcement, the company has scheduled its 41st Annual General Meeting (AGM) to be held on Tuesday, September 9, 2025, at 10:00 AM (IST) via video conferencing. The notice of the AGM, along with the Annual Report for FY25, has been sent to shareholders electronically. The company has engaged National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL) for providing e-voting services and VC facility for this AGM. The E-Voting start date is Saturday, September 6, 2025 (9:00 AM IST) and end date is Monday, September 8, 2025 (5:00 PM IST). Other key highlights from the AGM notice include:Adoption of the audited financial statements for the financial year ended March 31, 2025.Re-appointment of Mr. Thirulokchand Vasan as a Director of the Company.Appointment of Secretarial Auditors for a term of 5 years from FY 2025-26 to FY 2029-30.Fixing of borrowing limits for the Company up to ₹12,000 Crores.Creation of charges on the assets of the Company.Offer / invitation to subscribe to Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) on private placement basis up to ₹4,000 Crores.M/s. S. Sandeep & Associates will serve as the Secretarial Auditors for a term of 5 years commencing from Financial Year 2025-26 to Financial Year 2029-30 at a remuneration of ₹ 2,20,000 annually. The board also approved borrowing limits up to ₹12,000 Crores and authorized the issuance of Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) aggregating up to ₹4,000 Crores on a private placement basis. The Annual Report and AGM notice are available on the company's website and the websites of the stock exchanges. The board also approved borrowing limits up to ₹12,000 Crores and authorized the issuance of Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) aggregating up to ₹4,000 Crores on a private placement basis.

title: Astral Limited shares surge 4.14% amid high volume; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Astral Limited gained 4.14% to trade at Rs 1,332.10 in Monday's session, witnessing high volume and emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The stock experienced a notable jump in volume during the trading session. Astral Limited's financial performance shows consistent revenue and profit growth over the years. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,361.20 Crore, compared to Rs 1,383.60 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 79.20 Crore, down from Rs 119.50 Crore in the previous year. The EPS was Rs 3.02 in June 2025, compared to Rs 4.48 in June 2024. Here's a look at the consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,383.60 CroreRs 1,370.40 CroreRs 1,397.00 CroreRs 1,681.40 CroreRs 1,361.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 119.50 CroreRs 108.70 CroreRs 112.70 CroreRs 178.00 CroreRs 79.20 CroreEPS4.484.104.256.673.02The annual consolidated financial performance shows a steady increase in revenue. For the year ending March 2025, the revenue was Rs 5,832.40 Crore, up from Rs 5,641.40 Crore in March 2024. Net profit stood at Rs 518.90 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 545.70 Crore in the previous year. EPS was Rs 19.50 in March 2025, slightly lower than Rs 20.33 in March 2024. The following table summarizes the annual consolidated financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 3,176.30 CroreRs 4,394.00 CroreRs 5,158.50 CroreRs 5,641.40 CroreRs 5,832.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 415.20 CroreRs 492.30 CroreRs 461.00 CroreRs 545.70 CroreRs 518.90 CroreEPS20.1324.0817.0020.3319.50BVPS95.31117.57109.95121.46134.46ROE21.3420.7116.8417.1314.48Debt to Equity0.020.040.030.030.04Astral Limited announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (225%) on May 21, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025. Earlier bonus issues include a 1:3 ratio on February 7, 2023, and another 1:3 ratio on February 3, 2021. The company also underwent stock splits, including one on May 3, 2014, where the face value changed from Rs 2 to Rs 1. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on Astral Limited as of August 18, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,332.10, Astral Limited has shown significant movement amid high volume trading in today's session.

title: Syngene International shares rise 2.01%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Shares of Syngene International rose by 2.01% to Rs 681.00 in Monday's session, showing positive movement. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 11:03 am. On the financial front, Syngene International has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 874.50 Crore, up from Rs 789.70 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 86.70 Crore, compared to Rs 75.70 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased from Rs 1.89 to Rs 2.16. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 789.70 CroreRs 891.00 CroreRs 943.70 CroreRs 1,018.00 CroreRs 874.50 CroreNet ProfitRs 75.70 CroreRs 106.10 CroreRs 131.10 CroreRs 183.30 CroreRs 86.70 CroreEPS1.892.643.274.562.16The consolidated yearly revenue also showed an increase, rising from Rs 3,488.60 Crore in 2024 to Rs 3,642.40 Crore in 2025. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease from Rs 510.00 Crore to Rs 496.20 Crore, and the EPS decreased from Rs 12.71 to Rs 12.35. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,184.30 CroreRs 2,604.20 CroreRs 3,192.90 CroreRs 3,488.60 CroreRs 3,642.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 404.90 CroreRs 395.80 CroreRs 464.40 CroreRs 510.00 CroreRs 496.20 CroreEPS10.189.9411.5912.7112.35BVPS70.5482.2890.13105.92117.44ROE14.3512.0012.8311.9710.49Debt to Equity0.270.240.160.030.03Syngene International announced a final dividend of Rs 1.25 per share with an effective date of June 27, 2025. Syngene International is currently trading at Rs 681.00, marking a positive upturn in today's session.

title: Top midcap losers: Suzlon Energy, Deepak Nitrite, Glenmark stocks drag on Nifty Midcap 150 index today
content: Several stocks experienced declines in Monday's trading session, with some featuring among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 11:00 am, Suzlon Energy saw the largest drop at 2.05%, trading at Rs 58.83. Deepak Nitrite followed closely, falling 2.03% to Rs 1,819.00. Other notable declines on the Nifty Midcap 150 included Glenmark, which decreased by 1.46% to Rs 2,014.70, and GlaxoSmithKline, down 1.42% to Rs 2,730.20. Kalyan Jeweller also saw a notable decrease, falling 1.31% to Rs 526.50. title: Larsen & Toubro share price declines 0.83% in intraday trade

The stock is experiencing a change in price, with a 0.31% decrease in the last hour, relative to its previous price of Rs 3,657.90. title: Apollo Tyres shares jump 5.52% amid volume surge on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Apollo Tyres shares surged 5.52% to Rs 456.15 in Monday's session, driven by high volume and unusual trading activity. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On August 18, 2025, Apollo Tyres experienced a notable surge in trading activity. The stock's movement reflected a 5.52% increase from its previous close. title: UNO Minda shares surge 5.71% amid volume surge; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of UNO Minda witnessed a significant surge of 5.71% to Rs 1,215.40 in Monday's trading session. The stock experienced a volume surge, positioning it as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:57 am, the stock demonstrated notable activity, capturing investor interest. The company's financial performance reveals consistent growth. Consolidated quarterly revenue has increased steadily, with recent figures showing Rs 4,489.09 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, up from Rs 3,817.51 Crore in June 2024. Net profit also saw a rise, reaching Rs 261.77 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025 compared to Rs 174.10 Crore in the same period last year. Earnings per share (EPS) rose to Rs 5.06 in June 2025 from Rs 3.47 in June 2024. title: Suzlon Energy shares fall 2.03% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Suzlon Energy declined by 2.03% to Rs 58.84 in Monday's trading session, as of 10:55 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The company's financial performance reveals key insights. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,131.72 Crore, compared to Rs 2,021.59 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 324.32 Crore, up from Rs 302.29 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 0.24 in June 2025 from Rs 0.22 in June 2024. Annually, the consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 10,889.74 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 6,529.09 Crore recorded in March 2024. The net profit also saw a substantial increase, reaching Rs 2,071.63 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 660.35 Crore in March 2024. The EPS rose to Rs 1.52 in March 2025 from Rs 0.50 in March 2024. Analyzing the balance sheet, the total assets of Suzlon Energy were Rs 12,959 Crore as of March 2025, compared to Rs 7,179 Crore in March 2024. The company's equity and liabilities showed share capital at Rs 2,731 Crore and reserves and surplus at Rs 3,373 Crore as of March 2025. Key financial ratios indicate a P/E ratio of 37.28 and a P/B ratio of 12.66 as of March 2025. The company's debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.05 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial data:Financials (Consolidated Yearly)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)3,345.726,581.785,970.536,529.0910,889.74Net Profit (Rs Crore)100.34-166.192,887.29660.352,071.63EPS0.14-0.222.640.501.52BVPS-4.12-3.880.902.884.47ROE-3.020.00259.2016.8433.92Debt to Equity-1.23-1.181.730.030.05The following table summarizes the key financial data:Financials (Consolidated Quarterly)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)2,021.592,103.382,974.833,789.943,131.72Net Profit (Rs Crore)302.29200.60387.761,180.98324.32EPS0.220.150.280.870.24Recent corporate actions include an intimation of book closure and cut-off date announced on August 13, 2025. Additionally, the exchange sought clarification from Suzlon Energy regarding a media report about a Tata Power deal. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 11, 2025, indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 58.84, Suzlon Energy has seen a decline in today's session on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Endurance Technologies shares surge 10.1%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: In Monday's trading session, Endurance Technologies shares surged, gaining 10.1% to reach Rs 2,864.90 and securing a spot among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Other top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 include Escorts Kubota (9.19%), Vodafone Idea (8.13%), Voltas (7.63%), and Ashok Leyland (7.45%).Endurance Technologies: Financial PerformanceEndurance Technologies' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the years.Consolidated Yearly FinancialsHere is a summary of the company's consolidated yearly financials:YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,547.02519.5736.95253.2414.580.1220227,549.14460.7132.75278.6811.750.1020238,804.05479.5834.09313.6710.860.11202410,240.87680.4948.38353.8613.670.15202511,560.81836.3559.46406.4614.620.16The table illustrates consistent growth in Endurance Technologies' financial performance over the past five years. Revenue increased from Rs 6,547.02 Crore in 2021 to Rs 11,560.81 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, from Rs 519.57 Crore in 2021 to Rs 836.35 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 36.95 in 2021 to Rs 59.46 in 2025, and the book value per share (BVPS) rose from Rs 253.24 to Rs 406.46 over the same period. The return on equity (ROE) remained relatively stable, fluctuating between 10.86% and 14.62%. The debt-to-equity ratio also saw a slight increase, moving from 0.12 in 2021 to 0.16 in 2025.Consolidated Quarterly FinancialsThe consolidated quarterly financials provide a more recent view of the company's performance:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20242,825.50203.8614.49Sep 20242,912.66202.9814.43Dec 20242,859.16184.3913.11Mar 20252,963.49245.1317.43Jun 20253,318.89226.3516.09Quarterly revenues show an increasing trend, from Rs 2,825.50 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 3,318.89 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also increased, although with some fluctuation, from Rs 203.86 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 226.35 Crore in June 2025. EPS also reflects this growth, rising from Rs 14.49 in June 2024 to Rs 16.09 in June 2025.Corporate ActionsEndurance Technologies has announced several corporate actions, including dividend declarations. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (100%) on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of August 1, 2025. With Endurance Techn shares currently trading at Rs 2,864.90, the company has demonstrated significant financial growth and remains a strong performer in the Nifty Midcap 150.

title: Endurance Technologies shares surge 7.47% amid high volume, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Endurance Technologies shares jumped 7.47% to Rs 2,796.70 in today's session, witnessing a surge in volume. The stock is among the top gainers on NIFTY MIDCAP 150 as of 10:21 am. Financial Performance: Endurance Technologies has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the past few years. Here's an overview of their consolidated financial highlights: Quarterly Results: The company's quarterly performance shows a steady increase in revenue. title: SRF shares rise 2.13% in morning trade, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of SRF gained 2.13% to trade at Rs 2,902.40 in Monday's session, driven by positive investor activity. The stock is currently trading among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. In terms of quarterly financial performance, SRF's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,818.62 Crore, up from Rs 3,464.12 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 432.32 Crore, compared to Rs 252.22 Crore in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 14.58 in June 2025 from Rs 8.51 in June 2024. Here's a more detailed look at SRF's consolidated quarterly financials:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 3,464.12 CroreRs 3,424.30 CroreRs 3,491.31 CroreRs 4,313.34 CroreRs 3,818.62 CroreNet ProfitRs 252.22 CroreRs 201.42 CroreRs 271.08 CroreRs 526.06 CroreRs 432.32 CroreEPS8.516.799.1517.7514.58SRF's annual consolidated financials also provide insights into its long-term performance. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 14,693.07 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 13,138.52 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit decreased to Rs 1,250.78 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,335.71 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also saw a decrease, from Rs 45.06 in March 2024 to Rs 42.20 in March 2025. Here's an overview of SRF's consolidated yearly financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 8,400.04 CroreRs 12,433.66 CroreRs 14,870.25 CroreRs 13,138.52 CroreRs 14,693.07 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,198.25 CroreRs 1,888.92 CroreRs 2,162.34 CroreRs 1,335.71 CroreRs 1,250.78 CroreEPS40.5763.7572.9545.0642.20BVPS1,137.81287.97347.20385.93424.50ROE17.4722.0520.9311.639.90Debt to Equity0.430.410.420.430.37The annual income statement shows that SRF's sales increased from Rs 13,138 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 14,693 Crore in March 2025. The net profit, however, decreased from Rs 1,335 Crore to Rs 1,250 Crore during the same period. The company's board has announced several dividends. On July 16, 2025, an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (40%) was declared, with an effective date of July 29, 2025. Prior to that, on January 24, 2025, a second interim dividend of Rs 3.60 per share (36%) was announced, effective from February 4, 2025. On August 7, 2025, SRF made an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding newspaper publication. Earlier, on July 31, 2025, the company informed the Exchange about the earnings call transcript. The company also has a history of bonus issues, including a 4:1 bonus ratio announced on August 31, 2021, with a record date of October 14, 2021, and an ex-bonus date of October 13, 2021. Moneycontrol analysis indicates bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 18, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,902.40, SRF has shown a positive trend in today's session, trading among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Bharti Airtel share price rises 1.15% in morning trade
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,895.40 in Monday's session, a 1.15% increase from the previous close as of 10:40 am. Earlier in the session, the stock touched a day’s high of Rs 1,900.10 and a low of Rs 1,870.30. Financial Snapshot The following tables provide an overview of Bharti Airtel's financial performance. title: Bajaj Finance, Axis Bank, HDFC Bank shares rise up to 6% on S&P upgrade, GST reform cheer
content: The shares of banks and non-banking financial institutions saw strong rise in the morning trading hours of August 18. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Bank and Nifty Financial Services indices higher in the deep green. The Nifty Bank index was up more than 1.3 percent to hover around 56,035, while the Nifty Financial Services index rose nearly 2 percent to stand at 26,810, as seen at 10.10 am. Here are some of the key reasons leading to the uptrend in the financial pocket of the stock market: S&P upgrade: International credit ratings agency S&P Global on August 15 upgraded ratings of top 10 financial institutions, saying that India's financial institutions will continue to ride the country's good economic growth momentum. S&P has raised long-term issuer credit ratings on seven Indian banks - State Bank of India (SBI), ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, Axis Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Union Bank of India, and Indian Bank, and three finance companies - Bajaj Finance, Tata Capital, and L&T Finance. "We expect India's banks to maintain adequate asset quality, good profitability, and enhanced capitalization over the next 12-24 months. This is despite some pockets of stress," S&P said, adding, credit risk in the system has reduced. This boosted investor sentiment for the stocks, as well as the broader sector, a day after US-based agency raised India's sovereign credit rating. "S&P upgrade...is a significant macro and structural positive for the overall Indian market, likely supporting incremental valuation expansion driven by lower bond yields and decreased risk perception. Moreover, a higher sovereign rating will drive better FPI debt flows and lead to better USDINR and GOI bond yields. Foreign currency-heavy borrowers can benefit from lower interest costs. Indian financial companies, such as Bajaj Finance, accessing the ECB market could see a 15-20bp reduction on their coupon payments," said Motilal Oswal Financial Services. GST reforms: While delivering his Independence Day speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hinted at the next generation of Goods and Services Tax (GST) reforms to be announced as a Diwali gift for consumers. The Centre has proposed to move towards "simple tax" with 2 slabs—"standard and merit", with special rates applicable for only for select few items. According to reports, this will significantly reduce tax burden on consumers aiming to buy several items, like electronics and other consumer durables. More demand for consumer durables may in turn boost stocks like Bajaj Finance who offer affordable EMIs to consumers to purchase several goods. Broader market uptrend: The sharp rise in the share prices also comes amid broader optimism in the stock market today. Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to hover around 81,629, while Nifty crossed the key 25,000-mark level. HDFC AMC and several other stocks will likely be strongly benefitted from the optimism in the stock markets. Bajaj Finance shares jumped more than 6 percent, while Chola Finance, ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Company, Bajaj Finsev and SBI Life shares were up more than 4 percent, leading the strong gains on the Nifty Financial Services index. IndusInd Bank shares rose nearly 3 percent, while AU Small Finance Bank, IDFC First Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank shares were up nearly 2 percent each. Heavyweights ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank and Axis Bank shares were up more than 1 percent each, while SBI and PNB shares were hovering in the green with marginal gains. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: Here are some of the key reasons leading to the uptrend in the financial pocket of the stock market: S&P upgrade: International credit ratings agency S&P Global on August 15 upgraded ratings of top 10 financial institutions, saying that India's financial institutions will continue to ride the country's good economic growth momentum.
summary_lsa: This is despite some pockets of stress," S&P said, adding, credit risk in the system has reduced.

title: Deepak Nitrite shares fall 2%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Deepak Nitrite declined 2% to Rs 1,819.50 in Monday's trading session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Other notable losers on the index included GlaxoSmithKline, Global Health, Kalyan Jeweller, and Glenmark. Deepak Nitrite: Financial PerformanceExamining Deepak Nitrite's recent financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,889.88 Crore, compared to Rs 2,179.69 Crore in March 2025 and Rs 2,166.84 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 112.25 Crore, down from Rs 202.50 Crore in the previous quarter and Rs 202.53 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 8.23, compared to Rs 14.84 in March 2025 and Rs 14.85 in June 2024. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 8,281.93 Crore, up 7.81% from Rs 7,681.83 Crore in 2024. However, the net profit decreased 14.0% to Rs 697.37 Crore in 2025 from Rs 810.86 Crore in 2024. The EPS also declined to Rs 51.12 in 2025 from Rs 59.45 in 2024. The book value per share (BVPS) increased from Rs 353.57 in 2024 to Rs 395.06 in 2025, and the debt-to-equity ratio rose from 0.05 in 2024 to 0.22 in 2025.
summary_lexrank: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 8.23, compared to Rs 14.84 in March 2025 and Rs 14.85 in June 2024.
summary_luhn: The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 112.25 Crore, down from Rs 202.50 Crore in the previous quarter and Rs 202.53 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.
summary_lsa: Other notable losers on the index included GlaxoSmithKline, Global Health, Kalyan Jeweller, and Glenmark.
summary_textrank: The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 112.25 Crore, down from Rs 202.50 Crore in the previous quarter and Rs 202.53 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares decline 0.72% in morning trade; over 5.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading lower at Rs 3,650.70 on the NSE, a 0.72% decline from the previous close, in Monday's session. At 10:20 am, over 5.7 lakh shares changed hands. On the financial front, Larsen & Toubro has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,734.45 Crore, up 15.66% from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an increase of 13.6%, reaching Rs 17,687.39 Crore compared to Rs 15,569.72 Crore in the previous year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 109.36, up from Rs 93.96 in the previous year. The company’s quarterly performance also remained strong. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Larsen & Toubro reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 63,678.92 Crore and a net profit of Rs 4,325.57 Crore. In comparison, the quarter-ending June 2024 recorded revenue of Rs 55,119.82 Crore and net profit of Rs 3,440.11 Crore. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.33 for the year-ending March 2025. Larsen & Toubro announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share with effective date of June 03, 2025. The company had also announced bonus issues in the past. The most recent bonus issue was announced on May 29, 2017, with an existing ratio of 2:1 and an ex-bonus date of July 13, 2017. Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading lower at Rs 3,650.70 on the NSE, a 0.72% decline from the previous close, in Monday's session.

title: ITC shares fall marginally; over 63.8 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading at Rs 410.40 on the NSE, a marginal decline of 0.26% in Monday's session. Around 10:20 am, over 63.8 lakh shares changed hands. Trading Volume & Market Impact The traded volume for ITC shares stood at 6,386,671 on the NSE. Recent Financial Performance The consolidated quarterly financial performance shows a fluctuating revenue trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,765.00 Crore in March 2025. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to a significant jump to Rs 19,709.47 Crore in the previous quarter. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw a slight increase, reaching Rs 4.19 in June 2025 from Rs 15.77 in March 2025. The consolidated yearly financial performance reveals a consistent increase in revenue over the years. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 75,323.34 Crore, up from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in March 2024. However, net profit experienced a slight decrease, falling to Rs 19,926.05 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in March 2024. EPS showed a substantial increase, reaching Rs 27.79 in March 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 410.40 on the NSE, ITC's performance reflects a slight dip in today's session.

title: Ashok Leyland stock surges 8.33%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Ashok Leyland's stock is trading as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150, with a notable surge of 8.33% to reach Rs 132.12 in Monday's trading session. Other notable gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 include Endurance Techn, Blue Star, Escorts Kubota and Vodafone Idea. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the key financial performance indicators for Ashok Leyland:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,724.49 CroreRs 11,147.58 CroreRs 11,995.21 CroreRs 14,695.55 CroreRs 11,708.54 CroreNet ProfitRs 549.53 CroreRs 755.21 CroreRs 812.09 CroreRs 1,234.38 CroreRs 652.98 CroreEPS1.732.402.593.851.04The revenue for Ashok Leyland has shown a fluctuating pattern over the last five quarters. It increased from Rs 10,724.49 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 14,695.55 Crore by March 2025, before declining to Rs 11,708.54 Crore in June 2025. The net profit followed a similar trend, increasing from Rs 549.53 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 1,234.38 Crore in March 2025, and then decreasing to Rs 652.98 Crore in June 2025. The EPS also saw an increase followed by a decrease, mirroring the revenue and net profit trends. Yearly Performance: The table below presents the key financial highlights for Ashok Leyland over the past five years on a consolidated basis:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 19,454.10 CroreRs 26,237.15 CroreRs 41,672.60 CroreRs 45,790.64 CroreRs 48,535.14 CroreNet Profit-Rs 69.10 Crore-Rs 292.97 CroreRs 1,350.91 CroreRs 2,679.96 CroreRs 3,351.21 CroreEPS-0.56-1.224.238.4610.58BVPS31.1029.2636.7840.2341.66ROE-2.10-4.9014.5027.5825.39Debt to Equity2.313.283.614.514.06Ashok Leyland has demonstrated significant revenue growth over the past five years. The revenue increased from Rs 19,454.10 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,535.14 Crore in 2025. The company's net profit has turned from a loss of Rs 69.10 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 3,351.21 Crore in 2025. EPS has also improved from -0.56 in 2021 to 10.58 in 2025. The book value per share has increased steadily from Rs 31.10 in 2021 to Rs 41.66 in 2025. The return on equity has significantly improved from -2.10% in 2021 to 25.39% in 2025, indicating enhanced profitability and efficiency. Income Statement: The following table provides a consolidated view of Ashok Leyland's income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 48,535 CroreRs 45,790 CroreRs 41,672 CroreRs 26,237 CroreRs 19,454 CroreOther IncomeRs 358 CroreRs 140 CroreRs 110 CroreRs 86 CroreRs 131 CroreTotal IncomeRs 48,893 CroreRs 45,931 CroreRs 41,783 CroreRs 26,323 CroreRs 19,585 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 40,398 CroreRs 38,859 CroreRs 37,432 CroreRs 24,662 CroreRs 17,751 CroreEBITRs 8,494 CroreRs 7,071 CroreRs 4,351 CroreRs 1,661 CroreRs 1,834 CroreInterestRs 3,930 CroreRs 2,982 CroreRs 2,093 CroreRs 1,869 CroreRs 1,900 CroreTaxRs 1,213 CroreRs 1,409 CroreRs 906 CroreRs 85 CroreRs 2 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,351 CroreRs 2,679 CroreRs 1,350 Crore-Rs 292 Crore-Rs 69 CroreAshok Leyland's sales have increased consistently over the years, from Rs 19,454 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 48,535 Crore in March 2025. Other income has fluctuated, with the highest value of Rs 358 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure has also increased, reflecting the growth in sales. The earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) have shown a positive trend, with a significant increase to Rs 8,494 Crore in March 2025. After incurring losses in previous years, the company has seen a strong turnaround in net profit, reaching Rs 3,351 Crore in March 2025. Cash Flow: The table below presents the consolidated cash flow data for Ashok Leyland:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Operating ActivitiesRs 128 Crore-Rs 6,257 Crore-Rs 4,499 CroreRs 2,844 Crore-Rs 1,065 CroreInvesting Activities-Rs 5,758 CroreRs 1,135 Crore-Rs 2,934 Crore-Rs 1,916 Crore-Rs 991 CroreFinancing ActivitiesRs 6,957 CroreRs 8,431 CroreRs 7,280 Crore-Rs 377 CroreRs 1,330 CroreOthersRs 0 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 31 CroreRs 0 CroreRs 18 CroreNet Cash FlowRs 1,327 CroreRs 3,308 Crore-Rs 122 CroreRs 549 Crore-Rs 707 CroreAshok Leyland's cash flow from operating activities has fluctuated, with a significant negative value in 2024 and 2023 but recovering in 2025. Investing activities generally show a cash outflow, while financing activities provide a cash inflow. The net cash flow has varied, showing positive values in 2025 and 2024 but negative in 2023 and 2021. Balance Sheet: The table below outlines the key components of Ashok Leyland's balance sheet:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Share CapitalRs 293 CroreRs 293 CroreRs 293 CroreRs 293 CroreRs 293 CroreReserves & SurplusRs 11,938 CroreRs 8,710 CroreRs 8,217 CroreRs 6,968 CroreRs 7,568 CroreCurrent LiabilitiesRs 26,551 CroreRs 26,679 CroreRs 22,454 CroreRs 18,615 CroreRs 16,223 CroreOther LiabilitiesRs 42,931 CroreRs 31,976 CroreRs 23,762 CroreRs 17,722 CroreRs 17,981 CroreTotal LiabilitiesRs 81,714 CroreRs 67,660 CroreRs 54,728 CroreRs 43,600 CroreRs 42,066 CroreFixed AssetsRs 8,078 CroreRs 7,374 CroreRs 7,221 CroreRs 7,102 CroreRs 7,578 CroreCurrent AssetsRs 34,240 CroreRs 29,126 CroreRs 24,243 CroreRs 18,614 CroreRs 15,918 CroreOther AssetsRs 39,396 CroreRs 31,159 CroreRs 23,263 CroreRs 17,883 CroreRs 18,569 CroreTotal AssetsRs 81,714 CroreRs 67,660 CroreRs 54,728 CroreRs 43,600 CroreRs 42,066 CroreContingent LiabilitiesRs 476 CroreRs 940 CroreRs 756 CroreRs 917 CroreRs 864 CroreAshok Leyland's share capital has remained constant at Rs 293 Crore over the past five years. Reserves and surplus have increased from Rs 7,568 Crore in 2021 to Rs 11,938 Crore in 2025. Total liabilities have risen from Rs 42,066 Crore in 2021 to Rs 81,714 Crore in 2025. Fixed assets have remained relatively stable, while current and other assets have increased. Total assets have grown from Rs 42,066 Crore in 2021 to Rs 81,714 Crore in 2025, reflecting overall growth in the company's operations. Key Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Ashok Leyland are as follows:RatioMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Basic EPS (Rs.)10.588.464.23-1.22-0.56Diluted EPS (Rs.)10.568.454.22-1.22-0.56Book Value / Share (Rs.)41.6640.2336.7829.2631.10Dividend/Share (Rs.)6.254.952.601.000.60Gross Profit Margin (%)19.7017.6512.4810.8713.33Operating Margin (%)17.4715.6210.327.569.03Net Profit Margin (%)6.905.853.24-1.11-0.35Return on Equity (%)25.3927.5814.50-4.90-2.10ROCE (%)15.3717.4613.337.946.80Return On Assets (%)3.803.672.26-0.82-0.39Current Ratio (X)1.291.091.081.000.98Quick Ratio (X)1.140.940.930.860.83Debt to Equity (x)4.064.513.613.282.31Interest Coverage Ratios (X)2.432.712.491.530.92Asset Turnover Ratio (%)0.650.750.850.7046.24Inventory Turnover Ratio (X)12.147.589.456.967.793 Yr CAGR Sales (%)36.0153.4237.78-11.10-18.963 Yr CAGR Net Profit (%)238.21522.7771.95-63.37-80.51P/E (x)9.6510.1216.45-48.06-101.34P/B (x)4.905.584.784.714.24EV/EBITDA (x)11.0810.7113.8020.1819.65P/S (x)1.241.100.981.311.71Corporate Actions: Ashok Leyland Limited has been actively involved in several corporate actions. On August 14, 2025, the company informed the Exchange about an acquisition. Additionally, Hinduja Leyland Finance Limited, a material subsidiary, filed an intimation. An analyst/investor meet was held on August 14, 2025. The company has also announced dividends. An interim dividend of Rs.4.25 per share (425%) was announced on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of May 22, 2025. Ashok Leyland has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus ratio announced on May 23, 2025, with the ex-bonus date as July 16, 2025. In conclusion, Ashok Leyland's stock is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150, driven by a significant increase in its share price. The company's financial performance shows a positive trend in revenue and profitability, with active corporate actions aimed at enhancing shareholder value.

title: Nifty top losers: Larsen & Toubro, Sun Pharma, HCL Tech stocks drag on Nifty 50 index today
content: Several stocks experienced declines in Monday's trading session, with Larsen & Toubro, Sun Pharma, HCL Tech, Infosys and ITC among the top losers on the Nifty 50. At 10:30 am, Larsen & Toubro was trading at Rs 3,641.10, a 0.98% fall from the previous close. Sun Pharma was trading at Rs 1,634.50, down by 0.42%, HCL Tech at Rs 1,483.60, also down by 0.42%, Infosys at Rs 1,442.50, a 0.36% decrease and ITC at Rs 410.25, declining by 0.29%. Larsen & Toubro Financial Overview: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 26.30, compared to Rs 20.26 in June 2024. The company's annual consolidated revenue for the year 2025 reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, compared to Rs 15,569.72 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for 2025 was Rs 109.36, up from Rs 93.96 in 2024. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) decreased to Rs 710.12 in 2025 from Rs 746.01 in 2024. The Return on Equity (ROE) slightly increased to 15.39% in 2025 from 15.12% in 2024. The Debt to Equity ratio remained stable at 1.33 in 2025. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares trade flat in today's session; over 5.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading at Rs 3,021.40 on Monday. At 10:20 am, the stock traded flat on the Nifty 50, a marginal decline of 0.03% from its previous close; with over 5.7 lakh shares traded. Trading Volume & Market Impact The traded volume of Tata Consultancy Services shares on the NSE amounted to 579,103 shares. Financial Performance The consolidated revenue for Tata Consultancy Services has shown consistent growth over the years. The annual revenue increased from Rs 164,177 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,324 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit rose from Rs 32,562 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,797 Crore in 2025. The company's earnings per share (EPS) also improved from Rs 86.71 in 2021 to Rs 134.19 in 2025. The quarterly consolidated revenue for Tata Consultancy Services has also shown an increase. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, up from Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period increased to Rs 12,819 Crore from Rs 12,105 Crore. The EPS also rose to Rs 35.27 in June 2025 from Rs 33.28 in June 2024. The following table presents the consolidated annual financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177 CroreRs 191,754 CroreRs 225,458 CroreRs 240,893 CroreRs 255,324 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562 CroreRs 38,449 CroreRs 42,303 CroreRs 46,099 CroreRs 48,797 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613 CroreRs 64,259 CroreRs 63,973 CroreRs 64,479 CroreRs 63,437 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105 CroreRs 11,955 CroreRs 12,444 CroreRs 12,293 CroreRs 12,819 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27Tata Consultancy Services' balance sheet reflects a strong financial position. Total assets have grown steadily from Rs 130,759 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 159,629 Crore in March 2025. The company has maintained a consistent approach to managing its liabilities, with total liabilities increasing from Rs 130,759 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 159,629 Crore in March 2025. Key financial ratios for Tata Consultancy Services as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 134.19, a book value per share of Rs 261.76, and a dividend per share of Rs 126. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Tata Consultancy Services announced a third interim dividend of Rs 11 per share (1100%) on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. The company also announced a final dividend of Rs 30 per share (3000%) on April 11, 2025, effective from June 4, 2025. Additionally, a special dividend of Rs 66 per share (6600%) was announced on January 9, 2025, and a third interim dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) was announced on December 31, 2024, both with an effective date of January 17, 2025. The company had announced a second interim dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) on September 30, 2024, effective from October 18, 2024. Tata Consultancy Services has also issued bonus shares in the past. The company issued bonus shares at a ratio of 1:1 on April 19, 2018, April 20, 2009 and April 17, 2006. As per Moneycontrol analysis on August 18, 2025, the sentiment for Tata Consultancy Services is very bearish. With the stock trading at Rs 3,021.40, Tata Consultancy Services shows stable trading activity in today's session.

title: Bharti Airtel shares gain 0.91% in morning trade; over 17.4 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading higher at Rs 1,890.80 on the NSE, up 0.91% from the previous close, with over 17.4 lakh shares traded as of 10:20 am. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, Bharti Airtel has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the previous year. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 33,778.30 Crore, a substantial rise from Rs 5,848.60 Crore in the previous year. Here is a detailed look at Bharti Airtel's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021100,615.80-23,327.90-27.652022116,546.905,882.007.672023139,144.8011,535.3014.802024149,982.405,848.6013.092025172,985.2033,778.3058.00The table shows consistent growth in revenue from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. After a net loss in 2021, the company has shown strong profit growth, reaching Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202438,506.403,805.807.21Sep 202441,473.303,079.506.21Dec 202445,129.3014,474.9025.54Mar 202547,876.2012,418.1019.02Jun 202549,462.607,339.0010.26Quarterly revenue has grown steadily from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. Net profit saw a significant increase in December 2024, reaching Rs 14,474.90 Crore. Key financial ratios for the year-ending March 2025 include a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13, alongside a basic EPS of Rs 58.00. The company's return on net worth/equity stands at 25.58%. Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 8.00 per share in 2024 and Rs 4.00 per share in 2023. The company made several announcements recently, including disclosures under Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, and clarifications on volume movement letters. With the stock trading at Rs 1,890.80, Bharti Airtel has shown a positive trend in today's session, supported by strong financial performance and consistent dividend payouts.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares gain 3.55% in morning trade; over 11.6 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,568.60, up 3.55% in Monday's session. Around 1,164,510 shares changed hands on the NSE in today's session as of about 10.25 am. Financial Performance: Hindustan Unilever's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth over the years. The company's annual revenue has increased steadily from Rs 47,028 Crore in 2021 to Rs 63,121 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also risen consistently, from Rs 8,000 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,679 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have grown from Rs 34.03 in 2021 to Rs 45.32 in 2025. The company's book value per share (BVPS) stood at Rs 210.22 in 2025, return on equity (ROE) was 21.55%, and the debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00. The following table presents a summary of Hindustan Unilever's key annual financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202147,028.008,000.0034.03202.9516.770.00202252,446.008,887.0037.79208.8818.090.00202360,580.0010,145.0043.07214.9920.110.00202461,896.0010,286.0043.74217.9520.060.00202563,121.0010,679.0045.32210.2221.550.00The table below presents the key figures from the consolidated income statement on a yearly basis:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales63,12161,89660,58052,44647,028Other Income1,017811512258410Total Income64,13862,70761,09252,70447,438Total Expenditure49,32048,44347,63240,72436,715EBIT14,81814,26413,46011,98010,723Interest395334114106117Tax3,7443,6443,2012,9872,606Net Profit10,67910,28610,1458,8878,000The company's quarterly revenue has shown an increase in the recent period, with revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 at Rs 16,514 Crore compared to Rs 15,707 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,769 Crore, up from Rs 2,614 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Similarly, EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 11.73, compared to Rs 11.11 in the quarter-ending June 2024. The following table shows Hindustan Unilever's quarterly financial data:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202415,707.002,614.0011.11Sep 202415,926.002,601.0011.03Dec 202415,818.002,988.0012.70Mar 202515,670.002,476.0010.48Jun 202516,514.002,769.0011.73The table below showcases the quarterly income statement figures:Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Sales16,51415,67015,81815,92615,707Other Income201309232219257Total Income16,71515,97916,05016,14515,964Total Expenditure13,28412,53611,95712,48712,340EBIT3,4313,4434,0933,6583,624Interest1278011211093Tax535887993947917Net Profit2,7692,4762,9882,6012,614Key balance sheet figures show that total assets stood at Rs 79,880 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 78,499 Crore in the previous year. Fixed assets increased from Rs 37,303 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 37,878 Crore in March 2025. Current liabilities increased from Rs 12,876 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 16,537 Crore in March 2025. The cash flow statement indicates that net cash flow from operating activities was Rs 11,886 Crore for the year-ending March 2025. Cash flow from investing activities was Rs 6,473 Crore, while cash flow from financing activities was -Rs 13,101 Crore. Hindustan Unilever's basic EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 45.32. The company’s book value per share was Rs 210.22. The company had a dividend per share of Rs 53.00 for the year-ending March 2025. The debt to equity ratio stood at 0.00 as of March 2025. The P/E ratio was 49.84, and the P/B ratio was 10.75 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24.00 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 19.00 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) announced on October 10 and 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, including a 1:2 bonus ratio announced on September 30, 1991. A stock split was announced on July 5, 2000, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 1. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 11, 2025, suggests a very bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,568.60, Hindustan Unilever has demonstrated a strong performance in today's session, with over 11.6 lakh shares traded.

title: Vedanta shares rise 2.03% in morning trade
content: Shares of Vedanta gained 2.03% to trade at Rs 438.95 in Monday's session. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Vedanta's financial performance shows the following trends based on consolidated figures: Quarterly Performance: The company's quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating pattern. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 37,824 Crore, compared to Rs 40,455 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4,457 Crore, down from Rs 4,960 Crore in the previous quarter.ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 35,764.00 CroreRs 37,634.00 CroreRs 39,115.00 CroreRs 40,455.00 CroreRs 37,824.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,095.00 CroreRs 5,603.00 CroreRs 4,876.00 CroreRs 4,960.00 CroreRs 4,457.00 CroreEPS9.7211.269.098.928.15Annual Performance: The annual revenue has generally increased over the years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue was Rs 152,968 Crore, up from Rs 143,727 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 20,534 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 7,537 Crore in the year-ending March 2024.Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 88,021.00 CroreRs 132,732.00 CroreRs 147,308.00 CroreRs 143,727.00 CroreRs 152,968.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 15,033.00 CroreRs 23,709.00 CroreRs 14,506.00 CroreRs 7,537.00 CroreRs 20,534.00 CroreEPS31.3250.7328.5011.4238.97BVPS208.11222.32132.87113.09105.40ROE18.6228.7526.8213.7936.36Debt to Equity0.800.811.682.341.79The income statement provides further details. The annual sales for the year-ending March 2025 were Rs 152,968 Crore, compared to Rs 143,727 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 3,675 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 2,550 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The total expenditure for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 119,853 Crore, compared to Rs 116,449 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) was Rs 36,790 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 29,828 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. According to the cash flow statement, the net cash flow increased to Rs 1,181 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to a negative cash flow of Rs -4,114 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The balance sheet shows that the total assets and total liabilities both amounted to Rs 203,293 Crore as of March 2025, compared to Rs 190,807 Crore as of March 2024. Key financial ratios for Vedanta show a basic EPS of Rs 38.97 and diluted EPS of Rs 38.65 for March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.79 and an interest coverage ratio of 4.64 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Vedanta has a history of corporate actions, including dividends and bonus issues. A stock split was announced on April 28, 2008, with an ex-split date of August 8, 2008, and a record date of August 18, 2008. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 7.00 per share (700%) on June 13, 2025, with an effective date of June 24, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 438.95, Vedanta has shown a positive movement in today's session.

title: Indus Towers shares rise 2.04%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of INDUS TOWERS were trading higher in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 339.80, a 2.04% increase from its previous close. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:22 am. On the financial front, INDUS TOWERS has shown consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 8,057.60 Crore, up from Rs 7,383.00 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 1,736.80 Crore, compared to Rs 1,925.90 Crore in the previous year. title: Infosys shares fall marginally in today's session; over 14.3 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Infosys were trading at Rs 1,444.90 on the NSE, a marginal decline of 0.19% from the previous close, with over 14.3 lakh shares traded as of 10:20 am on Monday. Financial Overview: Infosys's financial performance showcases consistent growth over the past few years. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 162,990 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw an uptick, reaching Rs 26,750 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 26,248 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) has also improved, with the basic EPS for the year-ending March 2025 at Rs 64.50, up from Rs 63.39 in the year-ending March 2024. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has increased from Rs 212.74 in March 2024 to Rs 231.11 in March 2025. title: Vodafone Idea shares rally 8% as Q1 losses narrow; ARPU beats estimates, subscribers decline slows
content: Vodafone Idea shares rallied as much as 8.5 percent to Rs 6.68 in the morning on Monday, August 18, percent as investors took heart from the telco’s June quarter performance, where losses narrowed sequentially. The upbeat tone in the broader market also added to the momentum. At about 10:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 6.62, higher by 7.7 percent from the last close on the NSE. Despite the day’s uptick, Vodafone Idea remains under pressure — down 21 percent so far in 2025 and having shed nearly 60 percent over the past year. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The company reported its Q1FY26 numbers after market hours on August 14. Net loss came in at Rs 6,608 crore, wider than the Rs 6,432 crore loss a year ago but an improvement from Rs 7,166 crore reported in the March quarter. Revenue from operations stood at Rs 11,022 crore, up 5 percent year-on-year but flat sequentially. Average revenue per user (ARPU), a key operating metric, improved to Rs 177 against analyst expectations of Rs 167, aided by subscriber upgrades and a better customer mix. Motilal Oswal Financial Services noted that losses were narrower than its estimate of Rs 7,500 crore, helped by lower interest costs, while revenue trends were broadly in line. The brokerage also highlighted that subscriber erosion slowed during the quarter — Vodafone Idea’s user base slipped by just 0.5 million to 197.7 million, a sharp improvement from the 1.6 million decline seen in Q4FY25 and better than its forecast of a 1.2 million drop. Global brokerage UBS retained a Neutral stance on the stock with a target price of Rs 8.5, calling the June quarter performance broadly in line with expectations. It flagged a 0.6 percent quarter-on-quarter improvement in ARPU to Rs 165, stable revenues, and a 1 percent dip in EBITDA, with margins contracting 47 basis points to 41.8 percent. The brokerage also pointed out that the net loss was larger than anticipated, driven by higher interest charges, while capex moderated to Rs 2,440 crore in Q1 from Rs 4,230 crore in Q4 and Rs 3,210 crore in Q3. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Average revenue per user (ARPU), a key operating metric, improved to Rs 177 against analyst expectations of Rs 167, aided by subscriber upgrades and a better customer mix.
summary_luhn: The brokerage also highlighted that subscriber erosion slowed during the quarter — Vodafone Idea’s user base slipped by just 0.5 million to 197.7 million, a sharp improvement from the 1.6 million decline seen in Q4FY25 and better than its forecast of a 1.2 million drop.
summary_lsa: Revenue from operations stood at Rs 11,022 crore, up 5 percent year-on-year but flat sequentially.
summary_textrank: The brokerage also pointed out that the net loss was larger than anticipated, driven by higher interest charges, while capex moderated to Rs 2,440 crore in Q1 from Rs 4,230 crore in Q4 and Rs 3,210 crore in Q3.

title: United Spirits shares rise as management retains FY26 growth target, brokerages cautious
content: Shares of United Spirits recovered from day's low, up 2 percent to Rs 1,325 apiece on August 18 after brokerages were largely positive on the counter despite muted June quarter performance as the management continued to retain growth target for FY26. Goldman Sachs maintained a “buy” call with a target price of Rs 1,575 per share. It said Q1 results were ahead of estimates on topline, even though volume growth was muted after the Andhra Pradesh impact. The brokerage expects the UK–India Free Trade Agreement (FTA) to bring benefits from Q1FY27, helping both growth and margins. However, it cut FY26–28 earnings estimates by 2–4 percent. JPMorgan also stayed positive with an “overweight” rating but trimmed its target price to Rs 1,600 per share. It lowered FY26–27 EBITDA estimates by 5–6 percent to factor in the revenue decline from Maharashtra’s tax hike. At the same time, the brokerage said the stock’s sharp underperformance makes it a good entry level for investors, and it remains cautiously optimistic on the growth outlook. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Macquarie, however, maintained an “underperform” rating with a target price of Rs 1,250 per share. It pointed out that growth targets are being retained despite tax hikes in key states like Maharashtra. The brokerage said clarity on the impact of higher taxes will emerge during the festive season, but the company continues to expect double-digit growth in its prestige portfolio and aims to grow EBITDA faster than sales. The alcohol manufacturer reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 417 crore in the quarter ended June 30, compared with Rs 485 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue for the company rose 9.4 percent to Rs 3,021 crore from Rs 2,761 crore in the same quarter last year. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) declined 10 percent to Rs 644 crore from Rs 713 crore a year ago, while EBITDA margin contracted to 21.3 percent from 25.8 percent. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Ashok Leyland shares jump 7% on steady Q1 results, brokerages see up to 15% upside
content: Shares of Ashok Leyland climbed 7 percent to Rs 130 apiece on August 18 after the company reported an in-line set of June quarter (Q1FY26) numbers. The Street cheered its steady operating performance, with brokerages turning positive on the counter and projecting further gains of up to 15 percent from the day’s high. UBS reiterated a “buy” call on the stock with a target price of Rs 150, highlighting that the company delivered a margin beat on the back of operational discipline. The brokerage noted that medium and heavy commercial vehicle (MHCV) growth is expected in mid-single digits, while light commercial vehicle (LCV) growth could be slightly better. International markets, which continue to perform well, are expected to sustain momentum. Importantly, Switch Mobility – Ashok Leyland’s EV arm – turned profit before tax (PBT) positive in the June quarter. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Choice Broking also maintained a “buy” rating on the counter with a Rs 150 target, citing the company’s aggressive product pipeline. Ashok Leyland has lined up launches in the higher horsepower MHCV category, including 280–360 HP tippers, tractor trailers, and multi-axle vehicles, to cater to demand from mining, construction, and logistics sectors. A new bi-fuel LCV product is also in the works for large metros, along with upgraded offerings for global markets. “We believe these differentiated offerings will help Ashok Leyland strengthen pricing power, customer stickiness, and competitive positioning. With demand revival expected post-monsoon and a strong infrastructure push from the government, the company’s expanded product pipeline positions it for sustainable growth,” said Choice Broking. On the financial front, Ashok Leyland reported a net profit of Rs 594 crore in the June quarter, up 13 percent from Rs 526 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue rose 1.5 percent to Rs 8,725 crore compared to Rs 8,599 crore last year. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) stood at Rs 970 crore, up 6.6 percent from Rs 911 crore a year ago. Margins remained in line with estimates at 11 percent, expanding from 10.6 percent in the same quarter last year, aided by cost control and favourable pricing. title: KEC International shares gain 7% on orders wins of Rs 1,402 crore
content: KEC International share price jumped nearly 7 percent intraday on August 18 following the company secured new orders of Rs 1,402 crore across various businesses. At 09:55am, KEC International was quoting at Rs 822.55, up Rs 44.50, or 5.72 percent and touched an intraday high of Rs 831.55 and an intraday low of Rs 803.80. Its Transmission & Distribution (T&D) business has secured orders for T&D projects including 765 kV Transmission line from a marquee private player in India and supply of towers and hardware and poles in the Americas. The Civil business has secured a repeat order for a high-rise residential project from a renowned real estate developer in Northern India. The Cables & Conductors business has secured orders for supply of various types of cables and conductors in India and the overseas market. “We are pleased with the order wins across our businesses. In the India T&D business, we have expanded our customer base by securing a prestigious order from a reputed private player. We are also encouraged by the repeat order secured from a leading private developer in the Buildings & Factories (B&F) segment in India," said Vimal Kejriwal, MD & CEO, KEC International. "With these additions, our YTD order intake has surpassed Rs 8,400 crores. These orders, along with the orders announced earlier during the year, will substantially contribute towards our targeted growth going forward,” Kejriwal added.
summary_lexrank: “We are pleased with the order wins across our businesses.
summary_luhn: The Cables & Conductors business has secured orders for supply of various types of cables and conductors in India and the overseas market.
summary_lsa: KEC International share price jumped nearly 7 percent intraday on August 18 following the company secured new orders of Rs 1,402 crore across various businesses.
summary_textrank: Its Transmission & Distribution (T&D) business has secured orders for T&D projects including 765 kV Transmission line from a marquee private player in India and supply of towers and hardware and poles in the Americas.

title: JSPL, SAIL, Tata Steel shares shine after DGTR proposes three-year safeguard duty on key imports
content: Shares of leading steel makers Jindal Steel, SAIL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and JSL are sharply higher in early trade on August 18, after the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) recommended a three-year safeguard duty on imports of some categories of flat steel products in order to protect the domestic industry from rising imports. The Nifty Metal index is higher by over 1.2 percent in early trade, led by Jindal Steel and SAIL, which are up by close to 2 percent. Once approved by the Finance Ministry, the safeguard duty will kick in at 12 percent in the first year, followed by 11.5 percent in the second year, and 11 percent in the third year. DGTR said the decision is due to a surge in steel imports, especially from China, along with a steep fall in domestic industry profits. A provisional 12 percent duty was already in place, imposed on April 21, 2025, and now, in the final order, DGTR has said that imports have risen 'recently, suddenly, sharply and significantly' between October 2023 to September 2024. This threatens to cause "serious injury to the domestic industry/producers," the DGTR notification said. The current duty of 12 percent was to be in force till the end of September, and the imposition of the latest import levy is being seen as a positive move by the steel industry. The import duty has been recommended by the DGTR in its final report on a probe initiated following a complaint by the Indian Steel Association. The enquiry, initiated in December 2024, ranged across products like hot-rolled and cold-rolled steel, metallic and colour-coated steel. The Alloy Steel Producers Association of India (ASPA), representing players like Tata Steel and JSW Steel, had filed a petition on July 31, claiming that cheap imports from China were adversely affecting the industry. Another association, Indian Stainless Steel Development Association (ISSDA) too had filed an application with the DGTR to investigate the dumping of stainless steel items in the domestic market. However, trade think tank Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI) has cautioned against the move to impose duty on Chinese import, stating that it will "raise input costs, hurt export competitiveness, and squeeze downstream users." The GTRI argued that the rise in imports was predictable and not 'sudden', and the domestic impact was being overstated. The safeguard duty on steel imports could cripple automotive, engineering, and construction sectors by increasing input costs, GTRI said in its note. GTRI added that more than 250 stakeholders - including automakers and electronics companies had opposed the duty, warning of higher input costs and an impact on export competitiveness. The sentiment in steel stocks was also helped by the announcement by JSW Steel that it is has signed a non-binding agreement South Korea’s POSCO Group to explore setting up a six million tonnes per annum (MTPA) integrated steel plant in India.
summary_lexrank: Shares of leading steel makers Jindal Steel, SAIL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and JSL are sharply higher in early trade on August 18, after the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) recommended a three-year safeguard duty on imports of some categories of flat steel products in order to protect the domestic industry from rising imports.
summary_luhn: Shares of leading steel makers Jindal Steel, SAIL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and JSL are sharply higher in early trade on August 18, after the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) recommended a three-year safeguard duty on imports of some categories of flat steel products in order to protect the domestic industry from rising imports.
summary_lsa: The safeguard duty on steel imports could cripple automotive, engineering, and construction sectors by increasing input costs, GTRI said in its note.

title: Sensex leaps 1,000 points, Nifty reclaims 25,000 as auto stocks fuel rally amid GST buzz; IT, pharma weigh
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex surged at the open on Monday, August 18, buoyed by twin triggers — anticipation of a major GST revamp following Prime Minister Modi’s Independence Day address, and a landmark upgrade of India’s sovereign rating by S&P Global to BBB from BBB-, the first such move in nearly two decades with far-reaching implications for the economy. Auto, bank and metal stocks were the top gainers in the opening trade while the mid and smallcaps also mirrored positive trends to rise almost a percent each. At about 9:45 am, the Sensex was up 1,148.56 points or 1.43 percent at 81,746.22, and the Nifty was up 385.20 points or 1.56 percent at 25,016.50. About 2342 shares advanced, 967 shares declined, and 163 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "The outlook appears to be turning more favourable. A historic S&P ratings upgrade after 18 years has strengthened investor confidence and could pave the way for renewed foreign inflows. At the same time, next-generation GST reforms expected by Diwali are likely to streamline the tax structure and energise consumption-driven sectors," Devarsh Vakil, Head of Prime Research at HDFC Securities, said. "On the global front, potential progress on ceasefire talks between Russia and Ukraine, following the Trump-Putin summit, may help reduce risk-off sentiment. Adding to the momentum, sizable short positions held by foreign portfolio investors raise the prospect of a sharp short-covering rally, positioning Indian equities for a stronger phase ahead," he added. At the open on Monday, sectoral action was led by autos, with the Nifty Auto index jumping 3.6 percent, followed by consumer durables, up 2.7 percent. Banking stocks also lent support, with the Nifty Bank rising 1.2 percent and the Private Bank index up 1.4 percent. Metals, infra, PSU banks and energy saw modest gains, while FMCG and realty were flat. On the downside, IT and pharma edged lower in early trade. The India VIX was up 2.8 percent, reflecting heightened volatility. Among stocks, automobile makers such as Hero MotoCorp, Maruti Suzuki, Bajaj Auto, M&M and Tata Motors jumped up to 8 percent on Monday, August 18, after reports of a likely GST cut on entry-level two-wheelers, compact cars and hybrids. Hero MotoCorp topped the Nifty gainers’ list with a rally of more than 8 percent. Tobacco and online gaming stocks traded in the red on Monday, August 18, after reports suggested that the Centre proposed a 40 percent GST slab on 'sin goods,' sparking some selling in these counters. Key tobacco stocks were trading with losses, ITC, Godfrey Phillips, and VST Industries were lower between 0.5 percent to 1 percent. Online gaming stocks, Nazara Technologies Ltd and Delta Corp Ltd, both sank two percent. Telecom company Vodafone Idea rose 3 percent after it reported a Q1 FY26 net loss of Rs 6,608 crore, narrowing from Rs 7,166 crore in Q4 FY25. Revenue rose 5 percent YoY to Rs 11,022.5 crore, while ARPU grew 15 percent to Rs 177. UBS has maintained a Neutral call with a target price of Rs 8.5 per share after the company’s Q1 results came in largely in line with estimates. Technical View At present, the index is repeatedly facing supply pressure near the 20-DEMA cluster at 24,700–24,800. A sustained close above this area could spark short covering. On the flip side, failure to hold above 24,500 could extend the decline towards the next immediate support at 24,320, which may accelerate selling pressure. The daily RSI remains around 40, showing no strong reversal signal. Overall, the structure favours a sideways bias, with range-bound strategies continuing to hold merit. HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Maruti Suzuki, M&M, and Hero MotoCorp were the top gainers on the Nifty.
