title: GMR Airports share price rises over 2% in morning trade
content: Shares of GMR Airports gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 90.46 in Thursday's session. GMR Airports' financial performance reveals key insights based on consolidated quarterly and annual data. Revenue Trends: The company has demonstrated consistent revenue growth over the past year. Consolidated quarterly revenue increased from Rs 2,402.20 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 3,205.23 Crore in June 2025. Annually, the revenue rose from Rs 8,754.56 Crore in 2024 to Rs 10,414.24 Crore in 2025, marking a substantial increase. Net Profit/Loss: Despite revenue growth, the company has faced challenges in achieving profitability. The consolidated quarterly net profit stood at a loss of Rs 183.66 Crore in June 2025, compared to a loss of Rs 377.07 Crore in June 2024. The annual net loss decreased from Rs 1,054.05 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,001.72 Crore in 2025. EPS Trends: The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) reflects its profitability challenges. The consolidated quarterly EPS was a loss of Rs 0.20 in June 2025, compared to a loss of Rs 0.23 in June 2024. The annual EPS improved from a loss of Rs 0.93 in 2024 to a loss of Rs 0.43 in 2025.Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,402.20 CroreRs 2,495.46 CroreRs 2,653.24 CroreRs 2,863.34 CroreRs 3,205.23 CroreNet Profit-Rs 377.07 Crore-Rs 477.40 CroreRs 143.23 Crore-Rs 290.48 Crore-Rs 183.66 CroreEPS-0.23-0.290.25-0.23-0.20Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 3,566.01 CroreRs 4,600.72 CroreRs 6,693.40 CroreRs 8,754.56 CroreRs 10,414.24 CroreNet Profit-Rs 1,184.17 Crore-Rs 823.01 Crore-Rs 925.90 Crore-Rs 1,054.05 Crore-Rs 1,001.72 CroreEPS-4.64-1.70-0.30-0.93-0.43BVPS2.183.181.61-1.44-2.37ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-18.78-32.42-40.29-16.30-15.03GMR Airports' stock is currently trading at Rs 90.46, up 2.04% in today's session.

title: GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals shares fall 2.06%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 index
content: Shares of GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals were trading down by 2.06% at Rs 2,715.40 in Thursday's session. The stock is currently trading among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:12 am. This decline reflects a negative investor activity in the stock. On the financial front, GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 805.17 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 814.65 Crore reported for the quarter-ending June 2024. However, net profit for the same period increased to Rs 205.01 Crore, compared to Rs 182.33 Crore in the previous year. Here's a detailed look at the quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 814.65 CroreRs 1,010.77 CroreRs 949.42 CroreRs 974.37 CroreRs 805.17 CroreNet ProfitRs 182.33 CroreRs 252.50 CroreRs 229.88 CroreRs 262.87 CroreRs 205.01 CroreEPS10.7614.9113.5715.5212.10The company's annual performance also showcases significant growth. Net profit saw a substantial rise, climbing to Rs 927.58 Crore from Rs 589.96 Crore during the same period. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 41.14 to Rs 54.52. A final dividend of Rs 42 per share was announced on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. The company also issued bonus shares in the ratio of 1:1 on September 11, 2018. Overall, GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals is currently trading at Rs 2,715.40, reflecting a decrease from its previous close and placing it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150.

title: Varun Beverages share price falls over 2% in morning trade
content: Shares of Varun Beverages declined by 2.04% to Rs 500.65 in Thursday's trading session. At 10:03 am, the stock reflected a notable investor activity. Varun Beverages is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following tables provide a summary of Varun Beverages' consolidated financial performance. (x)10.7910.016.524.354.10The company announced several corporate actions. The Investment and Borrowing Committee approved increasing its stake in The Beverage Company Proprietary Limited, South Africa, on August 4, 2025. The Share Allotment Committee approved allotting 44,375 Equity Shares on August 4, 2025. The company issued a Corporate Guarantee on behalf of Varun Beverages (Zimbabwe) (Private) Limited on August 6, 2025. Varun Beverages has announced several dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share was announced on July 29, 2025, with an effective date of August 1, 2025. Another interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share was announced on April 30, 2025, effective May 7, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share was announced on February 10, 2025, effective April 4, 2025. Varun Beverages has issued bonus shares. A bonus ratio of 1:2 was announced on April 28, 2022, with an ex-bonus date of June 6, 2022. A bonus ratio of 1:2 was announced on May 3, 2021, with an ex-bonus date of June 10, 2021. A bonus ratio of 1:2 was announced on June 17, 2019, with an ex-bonus date of July 25, 2019. The company also underwent stock splits. On July 30, 2024, the face value was split from Rs 5 to Rs 2, with an ex-split date of September 12, 2024. On May 2, 2023, the face value was split from Rs 10 to Rs 5, with an ex-split date of June 15, 2023. Moneycontrol's analysis on August 8, 2025, indicated a neutral sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 500.65, Varun Beverages has exhibited a decline of 2.04% in today's session.

title: NHPC share price falls 2.06% in morning trade, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of NHPC experienced a decline of 2.06% in Thursday's trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 83.36. This movement places the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. In terms of quarterly financial performance, NHPC reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 3,213.77 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, compared to Rs 2,694.20 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,130.54 Crore, up from Rs 1,107.75 Crore year-on-year. The earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 1.06 for June 2025, compared to Rs 1.02 in June 2024. The following table shows the consolidated quarterly financial performance of NHPC:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,694.20 CroreRs 3,051.93 CroreRs 2,286.76 CroreRs 2,346.97 CroreRs 3,213.77 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,107.75 CroreRs 1,068.93 CroreRs 328.94 CroreRs 919.52 CroreRs 1,130.54 CroreEPS1.020.900.230.851.06Analyzing the yearly financial performance, NHPC's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 10,379.86 Crore, compared to Rs 9,632.16 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,409.37 Crore, a decrease from Rs 4,023.61 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) decreased from Rs 3.61 in March 2024 to Rs 2.99 in March 2025. The following table shows the consolidated yearly financial performance of NHPC:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 9,647.89 CroreRs 9,188.78 CroreRs 10,607.40 CroreRs 9,632.16 CroreRs 10,379.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,587.62 CroreRs 3,775.72 CroreRs 4,239.83 CroreRs 4,023.61 CroreRs 3,409.37 CroreEPS3.244.713.873.612.99BVPS35.7637.6141.5343.7039.49ROE9.8410.0910.549.367.57Debt to Equity0.660.750.800.840.99NHPC announced integrated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Additionally, the company issued 6.40% NHPC AG Series Bonds 2027 on a private placement basis, raising Rs 2,000 Crore. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 0.51 per share (5.1%) on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 1.40 per share (14%) was announced on February 7, 2025, effective February 13, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis on August 12, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for the stock. Shares of NHPC experienced a decline of 2.06% in Thursday's trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 83.36.
summary_lexrank: The company announced a final dividend of Rs 0.51 per share (5.1%) on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025.

title: Vodafone Idea share price falls 2.20% in morning trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea declined 2.20% to Rs 6.22 in Thursday's trading session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. This decline reflects the investor sentiment, with the stock trading lower compared to its previous close. Vodafone Idea's financial performance reveals a mixed picture. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 11,013.50 Crore, up from Rs 10,573.70 Crore in March 2024. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 7,168.10 Crore for the same quarter, compared to a loss of Rs 7,672.00 Crore in the corresponding period last year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at -Rs 1.01 in March 2025, as against -Rs 1.57 in March 2024. The following table summarizes Vodafone Idea's quarterly financial performance:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 10,573.70 CroreRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 7,672.00 Crore-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 CroreEPS-1.57-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01The yearly financial performance shows a positive trend in revenue. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 43,571.30 Crore, compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in the previous year. However, the company has consistently reported net losses. For the year-ending March 2025, the net loss was Rs 27,385.20 Crore, compared to Rs 31,232.90 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The EPS improved to -Rs 4.01 in March 2025 from -Rs 6.41 in March 2024. Here is a summary of the company's yearly financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-15.40-9.83-8.43-6.41-4.01BVPS-13.30-19.29-15.28-20.78-9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-4.12-3.08-0.18-1.99-2.79According to the yearly consolidated income statement, Vodafone Idea's sales for March 2025 stood at Rs 43,571 Crore, compared to Rs 42,651 Crore in March 2024, indicating a rise in revenue. The other income for the same period was Rs 1,020 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 113 Crore reported in the previous year. The company's total expenditure amounted to Rs 47,417 Crore, while the EBIT (Earnings Before Interest and Taxes) showed a negative value of Rs -2,825 Crore. Interest paid by the company was Rs 24,543 Crore. The net profit was reported as Rs -27,385 Crore. In comparison to March 2024, the sales increased by approximately 2.16%, while other income saw a substantial increase, total expenditure decreased and EBIT increased, and net profit increased. Vodafone Idea's cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 9,290 Crore. The cash flow from investing activities was Rs -16,248 Crore, and the cash flow from financing activities was Rs 7,046 Crore. The net cash flow for the same period was Rs 89 Crore. The balance sheet data shows that the company's share capital increased from Rs 50,119 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 71,393 Crore in March 2025. The reserves and surplus showed a negative balance of Rs -141,713 Crore. Total liabilities amounted to Rs 197,866 Crore, and total assets stood at Rs 197,866 Crore. Key financial ratios for Vodafone Idea show a Basic EPS of -Rs 4.01 and a Diluted EPS of -Rs 4.01 as of March 2025. The book value per share was -Rs 9.85. The company's debt-to-equity ratio was -2.79, and the interest coverage ratio was 0.78. Several corporate actions have been announced by Vodafone Idea. On August 12, 2025, the company entered into a Power Purchase Agreement and a Share Purchase Agreement for the acquisition of not less than 26% paid up equity share capital of Aditya Birla Renewables SPV 3 Limited. An analyst/investor call is scheduled for August 18, 2025, to discuss the company's performance for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025. Furthermore, a board meeting was scheduled for August 14, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of today. With the stock currently trading at Rs 6.22, Vodafone Idea is experiencing downward pressure amid recent corporate announcements and financial results.

title: Infosys, HDFC Life, Wipro stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: In Thursday's session, at 10:00 am, Infosys stock was trading at Rs 1,449.00, up by 1.57%, HDFC Life at Rs 788.30, up by 1.51%, Wipro at Rs 244.56, up by 1.2%, Maruti Suzuki at Rs 12,924.00, up by 0.7% and Trent at Rs 5,429.00, up by 0.56% and are among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Here's a detailed look at the financial performance and corporate actions of these companies:InfosysFinancial Performance: The consolidated quarterly financial performance shows consistent revenue and net profit. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, compared to Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 6,924 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 6,374 Crore reported in June 2024. The EPS also increased from Rs 15.38 to Rs 16.70. The consolidated yearly financials indicate steady growth. Revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 162,990 Crore, up from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024. title: Info Edge India shares jump 2.16% amid high volume in today's session
content: Shares of Info Edge India experienced a surge, with the stock price rising by 2.16% to Rs 1,354.60 at 09:55 am. The stock, listed on the NIFTY NEXT 50, witnessed high trading volume during the session. This trading activity suggests increased investor interest in Info Edge India. The company's recent financial performance and corporate actions have been closely monitored by investors. Financial Snapshot Info Edge India's financial performance reveals the following trends: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The consolidated quarterly performance shows consistent growth in revenue. For the quarter-ending June 2025, the company reported revenue of Rs 790.86 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 676.71 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. Net profit for the same period stood at Rs 347.38 Crore, compared to Rs 272.81 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS decreased to Rs 4.57 in June 2025 from Rs 7.16 in March 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 676.71 CroreRs 700.82 CroreRs 722.40 CroreRs 749.63 CroreRs 790.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 272.81 CroreRs 172.27 CroreRs 294.22 CroreRs 693.60 CroreRs 347.38 CroreEPS18.031.8018.757.164.57Consolidated Yearly Performance: The consolidated yearly performance indicates a steady increase in revenue and net profit over the years. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,849.55 Crore, up from Rs 2,536.34 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit also saw a substantial increase, reaching Rs 1,432.89 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 725.54 Crore in March 2024. EPS decreased from Rs 44.58 in March 2024 to Rs 14.83 in March 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 1,120.12 CroreRs 1,589.03 CroreRs 2,345.69 CroreRs 2,536.34 CroreRs 2,849.55 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,620.68 CroreRs 10,686.87 CroreRs 160.56 CroreRs 725.54 CroreRs 1,432.89 CroreEPS111.51991.38-8.3444.5814.83BVPS430.921,402.491,118.182,449.412,696.59ROE25.7774.00-0.801.902.75Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Consolidated Yearly Income Statement: The annual income statement showcases the financial performance of Info Edge India over the past five years. Sales increased from Rs 1,120 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 2,849 Crore in March 2025. Other income also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 1,073 Crore in March 2025. Total income increased from Rs 1,269 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,922 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure was Rs 1,830 Crore in March 2025. The EBIT was Rs 2,091 Crore in March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 2,696.59. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Info Edge India has announced several corporate actions. An analyst/institutional investor meet is scheduled for August 14, 2025, with Coatue Management, and another one is scheduled for August 20, 2025, with Hill Fort Capital. The company also published its unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 3.60 per share (180%) on May 27, 2025, with an ex-date of August 14, 2025. It also announced a stock split on February 5, 2025, with an ex-split date and record date of May 7, 2025. The old face value was Rs 10, and the new face value is Rs 2. The company issued bonus shares twice, on May 3, 2012 (1:1 ratio, ex-bonus date: June 22, 2012) and August 12, 2010 (1:1 ratio, record date: September 28, 2010, ex-bonus date: September 27, 2010). Recent Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,354.60, Info Edge India has demonstrated a strong presence in the NIFTY NEXT 50 index.

title: GE Vernova TD India shares fall 2.30% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of GE Vernova TD India experienced a decline of 2.30% in Thursday's trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 2,849.70. The stock is trading lower compared to its previous close. title: Hindustan Unilever share price flat in early trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,494.60 on the NSE at 09:30 am, a marginal decline of 0.02% from the previous close. Financial Snapshot: The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514 Crore, up from Rs 15,707 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,769 Crore compared to Rs 2,614 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 11.73 in June 2025 from Rs 11.11 in June 2024. title: UNO Minda shares rise 2.06% in early trade
content: UNO Minda shares demonstrated positive momentum in Thursday's early trading session, rising by 2.06% to reach Rs 1,137.40. This movement positions the stock among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Financial Overview UNO Minda's financial performance reveals consistent growth across key metrics. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,489.09 Crore, up from Rs 3,817.51 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 261.77 Crore from Rs 174.10 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also rose, reaching Rs 5.06 in June 2025 compared to Rs 3.47 in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 16,774.61 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 14,030.89 Crore in March 2024. The annual net profit increased from Rs 739.28 Crore to Rs 840.29 Crore, and EPS improved from Rs 15.36 to Rs 16.42. Quarterly Financials: ConsolidatedHeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 3,817.51 CroreRs 4,244.79 CroreRs 4,183.99 CroreRs 4,528.32 CroreRs 4,489.09 CroreNet ProfitRs 174.10 CroreRs 217.73 CroreRs 213.89 CroreRs 234.57 CroreRs 261.77 CroreEPS3.474.274.054.635.06Annual Financials: ConsolidatedHeading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,373.74 CroreRs 8,313.00 CroreRs 11,236.49 CroreRs 14,030.89 CroreRs 16,774.61 CroreNet ProfitRs 224.27 CroreRs 347.48 CroreRs 600.30 CroreRs 739.28 CroreRs 840.29 CroreEPS7.7312.6411.4215.3616.42BVPS94.01131.8277.3991.7199.64ROE9.1810.3415.7217.8116.48Debt to Equity0.380.240.300.320.40The company's annual income statement shows a consistent increase in sales, from Rs 6,373 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 16,774 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also increased significantly, from Rs 224 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 840 Crore in March 2025. Corporate Actions UNO Minda has announced several corporate actions, including announcements under Regulation 30 (LODR) related to credit ratings and earnings call transcripts. Additionally, the company has a history of dividend payouts, with the latest final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share announced on May 21, 2025. The company announced a bonus issue on May 24, 2022, with a bonus ratio of 1:1 and an ex-bonus date of July 7, 2022. Balance Sheet The company's total assets have grown steadily, from Rs 5,977 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 11,743 Crore in March 2025. This growth is supported by increases in both fixed assets and current assets. Shareholders equity, comprising share capital and reserves & surplus, has also seen substantial growth over the years. Financial Ratios Key financial ratios reflect UNO Minda's strong performance. The basic EPS for March 2025 was Rs 16.42, up from Rs 7.73 in March 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.40 as of March 2025. Valuation ratios include a P/E ratio of 53.32 and a P/B ratio of 8.81 as of March 2025. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 7, 2025, indicates a very bullish sentiment for the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,137.40, UNO Minda has demonstrated positive momentum, supported by strong financial performance and favorable market sentiment.

title: Apollo Hospitals Enterprises shares hit fresh all-time high and 52-week high before paring gains
content: Shares of Apollo Hospitals Enterprises gained 0.65% in the early morning trade to reach a fresh 52-week high and an all-time high of Rs 7,859.50 on the NSE. The healthcare stock gave up gains soon to swing into loss. It was trading at Rs 7,763 on NSE, down 0.6% at 9.55 am. Financial Performance: Apollo Hospitals Enterprises has demonstrated consistent financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,842.10 Crore, up from Rs 5,085.60 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 427.40 Crore, compared to Rs 304.00 Crore in the previous year. Corporate Actions: Apollo Hospitals Enterprises announced a final dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (200%) with an effective date of August 19, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 9.00 per share (180%) was announced with an effective date of February 14, 2025. The company had a stock split on September 2, 2010, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 5. A rights issue was announced on September 30, 1993, with an ex-rights date of March 10, 1993, and a rights ratio of 1:1. A recent Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 7, 2025.

title: Deepak Nitrite shares slide 5% after weak Q1; stock down 28% so far this year
content: Shares of Deepak Nitrite fell five percent to Rs 1,785 on August 14 after the company’s June quarter (Q1FY26) earnings fell short of market expectations. The weak performance weighed on sentiment, extending the stock’s downtrend this year. So far this year, this chemical stock has tumbled over 28 percent, underperforming benchmark Nifty 50's 2 percent rise. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog For the quarter ended June 30, 2025, Deepak Nitrite posted a 44.6 percent year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 112 crore, compared with Rs 202.5 crore in the same period last year. Revenue came in at Rs 1,889.8 crore, down 12.8 percent from Rs 2,166.8 crore in the year-ago quarter, reflecting soft demand and pricing pressure in several product segments. Operating performance took a sharper hit, with EBITDA slipping 38.8 percent year-on-year to Rs 189.3 crore from Rs 309.4 crore in Q1FY25. The EBITDA margin contracted to 10 percent from 14.3 percent last year, as higher input costs and lower realisations eroded profitability. Deepak Nitrite faced pressure across both its core business divisions during the quarter. In the Advanced Intermediates segment, revenue fell 15 percent to Rs 605.33 crore, while EBIT (earnings before interest and taxes) tumbled 47 percent to Rs 35.47 crore. In the Phenolics segment, revenue declined 11 percent to Rs 1,303.96 crore, with EBIT sliding 43 percent to Rs 117.90 crore. Despite the current challenges, Deepak Nitrite remains optimistic about its future prospects, saying multiple projects are underway, including capacity expansion, securing stable input supplies, and driving both backward and forward integration. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Operating performance took a sharper hit, with EBITDA slipping 38.8 percent year-on-year to Rs 189.3 crore from Rs 309.4 crore in Q1FY25.
summary_luhn: In the Advanced Intermediates segment, revenue fell 15 percent to Rs 605.33 crore, while EBIT (earnings before interest and taxes) tumbled 47 percent to Rs 35.47 crore.
summary_lsa: Deepak Nitrite faced pressure across both its core business divisions during the quarter.
summary_textrank: Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog For the quarter ended June 30, 2025, Deepak Nitrite posted a 44.6 percent year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 112 crore, compared with Rs 202.5 crore in the same period last year.

title: NMDC share price falls 4.48%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of NMDC declined 4.48% to Rs 69.33 in early trade, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Other notable losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 included Deepak Nitrite, Hindustan Petroleum Corporation, Max Healthcare, and AIA Engineering. At 09:30 am, these stocks experienced significant declines, reflecting broader market trends. Financial Overview of NMDC NMDC's financial performance shows a mix of quarterly and annual results. Here’s a summary: Quarterly Performance: The company’s revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 6,738.85 Crore, up from Rs 5,414.19 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 1,967.46 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 1,963.35 Crore reported in June 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased to Rs 2.24 in June 2025 from Rs 6.72 in June 2024. Annual Performance: For the year-ending March 2025, NMDC reported revenue of Rs 23,905.52 Crore, compared to Rs 21,307.85 Crore in the previous year. Net profit increased to Rs 6,539.75 Crore from Rs 5,572.24 Crore. However, the EPS decreased to Rs 7.44 in March 2025 from Rs 19.02 in March 2024. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share (100%) on May 27, 2025, with an effective date of August 14, 2025. Additionally, a bonus issue was announced on November 11, 2024, with a bonus ratio of 2:1 and an ex-bonus date of December 27, 2024. The company also had a stock split on April 10, 2008, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1. NMDC's financial performance shows a mix of quarterly revenue growth and annual profit increases, alongside recent corporate actions including dividend announcements and a bonus issue.

title: Anthem Bio shares surge 5 percent on strong show in CRDMO and specialty business
content: Recently listed CRDMO player Anthem Biosciences are sharply higher by nearly 5 percent after the company posted strong June quarter results. The company posted a consolidated revenue from operations at Rs 540 crore, higher by 59 percent on year, and a net profit of Rs 135.8 crore, up 65 percent on year. Revenue from the CRDMO business grew up 70 percent on year. Anthem's EBITDA rose by 52.7 percent to Rs 214.3 crore. Ajay Bhardwaj, Chairman, Managing Director and CEO, Anthem Biosciences attributed to result to good performance across the CRDMO and Specialty Ingredients business. “Strong YoY growth in Q1FY26 reflects a CRDMO revenue stream that started ramping up since Q2FY25." the CRDMO business generated nearly 84 percent of the revenue during the June quarter. Anthem Bio has completed the expansion of its 54 kL custom synthesis capacity at Unit II, Harohalli, and commenced commercial operations. At its Unit III, operations commenced in a phased manner, including the custom synthesis block with an R&D laboratory, pilot laboratory, kilo laboratory, and hydrogenation facility. Read More: Anthem Biosciences IPO: A solid CDMO story The Harohalli unit also saw the inauguration of a state-of-the-art commercial-scale peptide manufacturing facility with a 16 kL capacity and a hi-potent manufacturing facility with a 2.5 kL capacity. At Unit IV, Harohalli, construction is underway for a new greenfield facility on a 30-acre site, the management informed.
summary_lexrank: The company posted a consolidated revenue from operations at Rs 540 crore, higher by 59 percent on year, and a net profit of Rs 135.8 crore, up 65 percent on year.
summary_luhn: The company posted a consolidated revenue from operations at Rs 540 crore, higher by 59 percent on year, and a net profit of Rs 135.8 crore, up 65 percent on year.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares gain 0.41% in early trade
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares saw a positive movement in Thursday's early trading session, with the stock price increasing by 0.41% to Rs 3,048.50. Financial Performance The financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services reveals consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Here's an overview: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial data for TCS:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 63,437.00 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 64,479.00 Crore reported for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 increased to Rs 12,819.00 Crore, compared to Rs 12,293.00 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS also increased from 33.79 to 35.27 during the same period. Similarly, the net profit rose from Rs 32,562.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,797.00 Crore in 2025. EPS also improved, reaching 134.19 in 2025 compared to 86.71 in 2021. Return on Equity (ROE) increased from 37.52% in 2021 to 51.24% in 2025. The company maintained a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 throughout the period. Key Financial Ratios: Tata Consultancy Services exhibits strong financial metrics as of March 2025. The Basic EPS (Earnings Per Share) stood at Rs 134.19, with a Diluted EPS of Rs 134.19. The Book Value per Share (excluding revaluation reserve) was Rs 261.76. The company's Dividend per Share was Rs 126.00, and it maintains a Face Value of 1. Margin Ratios: The Gross Profit Margin was 27.95%, while the Operating Margin stood at 25.89%. The Net Profit Margin was 19.11%. Return Ratios: The Return on Networth/Equity was 51.24%. ROCE (Return on Capital Employed) was 62.01%, and the Return on Assets was 30.41%. Liquidity Ratios: The Current Ratio was 2.32, and the Quick Ratio was also 2.32. Leverage Ratios: The Debt to Equity ratio was 0.00, and the Interest Coverage Ratio was 89.66. Turnover Ratios: The Asset Turnover Ratio was 1.67%, and the Inventory Turnover Ratio was 0.00. Growth Ratios: The 3-Year CAGR Sales was 15.39%, and the 3-Year CAGR Net Profit was 12.66%. Valuation Ratios: The P/E (Price to Earnings) ratio was 26.87, the P/B (Price to Book) ratio was 13.77, EV/EBITDA (Enterprise Value to Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) was 18.08, and the P/S (Price to Sales) ratio was 5.11. Corporate Actions Tata Consultancy Services has announced several corporate actions, including dividend payouts and bonus issues. Here are some highlights: Dividends:On June 27, 2025, an interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (1100%) was announced, effective July 16, 2025.On April 11, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (3000%) was announced, effective June 04, 2025.On January 09, 2025, a special dividend of Rs 66.00 per share (6600%) was announced, effective January 17, 2025.Bonus Issues:A bonus issue with a ratio of 1:1 was announced on April 19, 2018, with the ex-bonus date on May 31, 2018.Another bonus issue with a ratio of 1:1 was announced on April 20, 2009, with the ex-bonus date on June 16, 2009.A bonus issue with a ratio of 1:1 was announced on April 17, 2006, with the ex-bonus date on July 28, 2006.Tata Consultancy Services shares saw a positive movement in Thursday's early trading session, with the stock price increasing.
